sense.name: (cause to) become undone by separating parts of
sense.examples: The cat unraveled the thread. The sweater unraveled. I unraveled the rope and wounded it around a peg.

sense.name: resolve the intricacy of; come out of obscurity
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[human] UNRAVEL NP2 NP1[agent] UNRAVEL NP2 NP1[abstract] UNRAVEL PP Note: Object is not destroyed (compare to Senses 1 and 3)
sense.examples: Can you unravel the mystery? A war is unravelling in Africa and no one cares. I had nothing of substance to unravel our case unless I outed the murderer.

sense.name: reverse, undo, become undone, destroy
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[theme] UNRAVEL NP1[theme] UNRAVEL NP2[abstract]
sense.examples: Most companies would have unraveled by now. Launching a full-fledged bid could unravel the GM-Jaguar talks.
